intro: Commelina bakueana, commonly known as the African spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Commelina bakueana is also noted for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in various herbal remedies.
